headlines: We set out with a mission to make all the world’s art freely accessible to anyone with an Internet connection.
To fulfill this mission, we’re building the largest public database of art for educational use…
…and making it possible to find and collect art and design from galleries around the world—all in one place.

credits.name: Édouard Manet
credits.title: Luncheon on the Grass (Le Déjeuner sur l'herbe)

galleries-and-museums-shared.headline: Galleries and Museums shared over 8,500 shows on Artsy

galleries-uploaded-graph.headline: Galleries uploaded 80,000 for-sale works…
galleries-uploaded-graph.caption: In the last month of 2014 galleries uploaded more for sale artworks than in the whole of 2013.

introductions-made-graph.headline: …and we made 53,000 introductions between galleries and collectors.
introductions-made-graph.caption: In the last month of 2014 we made more introductions between galleries and collectors than what we did in the whole year of 2013.

museums-and-institutions.headline: 400 museums and institutions now share their shows and collections on Artsy.
museums-and-institutions.description: This year we welcomed some of the most distinguished museums in the world from The Museé de Louvre, Palais de Tokyo, …

educational-database.headline: From Michelangelo to Mondrian, Artsy’s educational database now contains over 230,000 artworks.

added-categories.headline: We added over 100 categories to the Art Genome Project…
added-categories.description: The Art Genome Project is the classification system that maps the characteristics that connect artists, artworks, architecture, and design objects across history.

benefit-auctions-raised.headline: Benefit auctions raised more than $10.8m for the arts, AIDS research and more…
benefit-auctions-raised.description: Aperture Foundation, Brooklyn Artists Ball, Whitney Art Party, Watermill Center, Swiss Institute, Public Art Fund, Ballroom Marfa, and more. (others TWO × TWO for AIDS and Art, Independent Curators International, etc.)

powered-by-artsy.headline: …powered by Artsy’s bidding technology.
powered-by-artsy.description: Bids could be placed on Artsy.net, Artsy’s app, or through dedicated bidding stations at the Auction events. Guests at the events could see new bids in real time.

browse-and-collect-fairs.headline: In 2014 you could browse and collect from 37 art fairs on Artsy…

mobile-app.headline: …and Artsy’s mobile app guided fair visitors to their favorite works and artists.
mobile-app.description: Artworks saved through Artsy’s mobile app was displayed in real-time on 9-foot tall display screens throughout the fair. The displays also showed visitors which artists and exhibitors was trending at the fair.

partners-in-cities.headline: Artsy now has partners in more than 190 cities around the globe…

average-distance.headline: and the average distance between collectors and the work inquired on was 2,700 miles.

joined-artsy.headline: This year, 34 great people have joined the Artsy Team working to make the art world accesible online.

conclusion.message:
Thank you everyone who made this year possible.

Artists, Galleries, Museums, Institutions, Fairs, Students and Art Lovers, Writers, Designers & Technologists. And You.
